Text:
Shoeboxes are no longer in vogue 
 Not even tins with bright paint  
 Memories are uploaded - 
 On drives, phones, desktops.

These things that need preserving 
 Do they know they are to be rescued? 
 What museum would keep these? 
 Traces of youth, proofs of living

Not data, not evidence 
 … but memories! 
 Of children’s laughter  
 And stories under seas of stars. 
 Tiny pieces of me are still alive here.

The digital age is alive with people 
 Who think their memory is worth more than gold

But can they see it in front of them? 
 A new generation is learning about memory 
 And the truth about us. 
 Are we all born with a memory? 
 Maybe. Or not

The more we know about the nature of memory 
 The more we wonder, 
 Are we really born with a memory?
THINK: A caterpillar becomes a butterfly if it’s a patient cocoon.
